stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why the creation of the European Union had only limited success in reducing nationalist and ethnic tensions in Europe in the postwar period?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of nationalism and ethnic conflict in the postwar period.

choicesHtml: The European Union boosted economic growth, but it also allowed for increased migration within Europe, sometimes causing a sense of cultural dislocation.
The European Union was begun as an attempt at greater economic integration, which it was hoped would make future military conflicts among European countries unlikely.
The European Union was created gradually, over the course of several decades, with each major step subject to ratification by member countries.
The European Union resulted in greater diplomatic and military cooperation among member states, but the Union failed to create a unified European army.
